channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One big Wall Street firm is calling for the end of dollar selling, at least for now
item.description: Citi anticipates sideways trading in the dollar, but remains bearish further out.

item.title: I have early Alzheimer’s and my husband has stage 4 kidney disease. We just inherited $50K. How can this help us?
item.description: “We have a 401(k) with $20,000, and $29,000 in a Roth IRA.”

item.title: ‘American Horror Story’ actress Sarah Paulson lists $3 million Hollywood home, after selling Malibu trailer for $1.45 million
item.description: Paulson is preparing to part ways with her longtime Los Angeles abode, putting the midcentury modern Hollywood Hills home on the market for $3 million...

item.title: Trump says Coke with cane sugar is on its way. But Americans seem fine with the current version.
item.description: Some studies reveal a preference for Coke produced just as it is — with high-fructose corn syrup.

item.title: Can my husband contest his late brother’s $600K will? He experienced oxygen deprivation due to COPD before he died.
item.description: “Around 30 days before passing, he changed everything to go to a friend.”

item.title: Friday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session

item.title: One Wall Street stock bucking the weak trend, according to the charts
item.description: David Keller breaks down the charts on Apollo.

item.title: Best Stocks: A company that's indispensable to its customers with a stock in a pristine uptrend
item.description: Some of the biggest winners in the history of the stock market have been indispensable to customers. Think Salesforce, Apple, Costco, and Starbucks.

item.title: Wall Street says McDonald's snack wrap revival is a hit so buy the stock
item.description: Analysts at several firms have this week told clients that the return of the Snack Wrap is a positive.

item.title: These stocks could benefit if Trump expands private markets access in 401(k) plans, analysts say
item.description: A few asset managers could catch a tailwind if the Trump administration expands access to private market investments in retirement plans.
